contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox public transit |box_width = |name =Kyoto Municipal Subway |image =Kyoto MTB Logo.svg |alt =Kyoto Municipal Subway Logo |imagesize =80 |image2 = |alt2 = |imagesize2 = |caption =Kyoto Municipal Subway Logo |owner = |locale =[[Kyoto]] |transit_type =Rapid Transit |lines =2 |stations =29 |ridership = |annual_ridership = |chief_executive = |headquarters = |website = |began_operation ={{Start date|1981}} |operation_will_start = |ended_operation = |operator =[[Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau]] |marks = |vehicles = |train_length = |headway = |system_length = {{convert|28.8|km|mi|2|abbr=on}} |track_gauge = |ogauge = |minimum_radius_of_curvature = <!-- {{convert|0|ft|0|in|mm|0}} --> |el = |average_speed = <!-- {{convert|0|mph|km/h|abbr=on}} --> |top_speed = <!-- {{convert|0|mph|km/h|abbr=on}} --> |osm_id = |map = [[File:Kyoto Metro Map.png|250px]]<br>Map of Kyoto Municipal Subway |map_state = collapsed }} {{nihongo|'''Kyoto Municipal Subway'''|京都市営地下鉄|Kyōto-shiei chikatetsu}} is the [[rapid transit|metro]] network in the city of [[Kyoto]], [[Japan]]. It is operated by [[Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau]]. It has two lines. ==Lines== {| class="wikitable" <!--style="margin: 0 auto; text-align:center;"--> ! colspan=2| Color & Icon ! colspan=2| Name ! Mark ! First section<br />opened ! Last ex-<br />tension ! Length<br />km/miles ! Stations |- | rowspan=3 style="background:#3cb371; color:white;"|green | rowspan=3|[[File:Subway KyotoKarasuma.png|25px]] | - | style="text-align:left;"|[[Karasuma Line]] | K | 1981 | 1997 | 13.7/8.5 | 15 |- | rowspan=2|''Via trackage rights'' | style="text-align:left;"|[[Kintetsu]] [[Kintetsu Kyoto Line|Kyōto Line]] | rowspan=2|- | 1988<ref>Between [[Takeda Station (Kyoto)|Takeda Station]] and [[Yamato-Saidaiji Station]]</ref> | 2000 | 31.0/19.3 | 22<ref>Including [[Takeda Station (Kyoto)|Takeda Station]]</ref> |- | style="text-align:left;"|[[Kintetsu]] [[Kintetsu Nara Line|Nara Line]] | 2000<ref>Between [[Yamato-Saidaiji Station]] and [[Kintetsu Nara Station]]</ref> | - | 4.4/2.7 | 3<ref>Including [[Yamato-Saidaiji Station]]</ref> |- | rowspan=3 style="background:orangered; color:white;"|vermilion | rowspan=3|[[File:Subway KyotoTozai.png|25px]] | - | rowspan=3 style="text-align:left;"|[[Tōzai Line (Kyoto)|Tōzai Line]] | rowspan=3| T | 1997<ref>Between [[Rokujizō Station]] and [[Misasagi Station]]</ref> | 2004 | 8.7/5.4 | 8 |- |''Via trackage rights'' | 1997<ref>Owned by [[Kyoto High-Speed Rail]] between [[Misasagi Station]] and [[Sanjō Keihan Station]]</ref> | - | 3.4/2.1 | 4<ref>Including [[Misasagi Station]] and [[Sanjō Keihan Station]]</ref> |- | - | 1997<ref>Between [[Sanjō Keihan Station]] and [[Nijō Station (Kyoto)|Nijō Station]]</ref> | 2008 | 3.0/1.9 | 5 |} ==See also== * [[List of metro systems]] * [[Transport in Greater Osaka]] == External links == *{{commonscat-inline|Kyoto Subway}} *[http://www.city.kyoto.jp/koho/eng/access/transport.html Public transport in Kyoto] *[http://www.cityrailtransit.com/maps/kyoto_map.htm Network map (to scale)] ==Notes== <references /> {{Metro systems in Japan}} {{Osaka transit}} [[Category:Kyoto]] [[Category:Kyoto Municipal Subway|*]]
